ideas.title: Westminster's Winning Strategy
ideas.premise: The Westminster Chess Club defeats their rival borough using only moves named after famous Westminster landmarks (e.g., the 'Big Ben Gambit').
ideas.why_funny: Absurdity of chess moves named after local landmarks; highlights Westminster's identity.

ideas.title: The Paving Predicament
ideas.premise: Construction workers find the long-lost Crown Jewels buried beneath Parliament Square, delaying the infrastructure project indefinitely.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of mundane infrastructure with national treasures; pokes fun at bureaucratic delays.

ideas.title: Brolly Forecast
ideas.premise: The Westminster weather forecast is perpetually 'clear skies,' depicted as a man frantically trying to shield Parliament from rain with a tiny umbrella.
ideas.why_funny: Exaggerates the optimism of weather reports and the futility of controlling the weather.

ideas.title: Expansion Plans
ideas.premise: A tiny tea shop expands to occupy the entire Houses of Parliament, serving only Earl Grey and complaining about tourists.
ideas.why_funny: Plays on the quintessential Britishness of tea shops and their stereotypical customers, magnified absurdly.

ideas.title: Pigeon Party
ideas.premise: Huge crowds are shown at the community event - all pigeons, attracted by a Westminster Council member handing out discarded chips.
ideas.why_funny: Satirical commentary on poorly attended events, humorously substituting humans with pigeons.

headlines.summary: City council meets to discuss improvements

headlines.summary: Recent victory keeps hopes alive for title
